decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of creatures and removal spells. The deck utilizes cards like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller to control the board and maintain pressure with creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker. Collected Company helps to rapidly put more threats on the battlefield, while cards like Selfless Spirit provide protection. The mana base is designed to allow for consistent access to all of the colors needed for the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on playing cheap, aggressive creatures like Stormchaser Mage and Thermo-Alchemist, while also using burn spells such as Incendiary Flow and Fiery Temper to deal damage to the opponent's creatures and face. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while drawing cards with Tormenting Voice and Fevered Visions to keep the hand full of threats. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a mix of creature damage and direct burn spells.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Lambholt Pacifist and Thalia's Lieutenant, while using disruption cards like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar to control the opponent's board. Collected Company provides card advantage and helps flood the board with creatures. Dromoka's Command offers additional versatility by providing removal and combat tricks. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and tempo plays, while also generating value through card draw and creature synergies.

This deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, powerful creatures, and recursion to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Fiery Impulse and Languish, while deploying threats like Liliana, the Last Hope and Ishkanah, Grafwidow to generate advantage. The deck also utilizes cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Grapple with the Past to fuel the graveyard for Delirium and access powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. Overall, the strategy involves grinding out the opponent through efficient removal and value-generating cards.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By using cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command, the deck can quickly build a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Thalia's Lieutenant and Reflector Mage provide additional value and tempo advantage, while Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Tamiyo, Field Researcher offer powerful planeswalker support. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy while also allowing for consistent casting of spells.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure early on. By efficiently developing your board presence and leveraging the synergy between your creatures and spells, you aim to quickly outpace and outmaneuver your opponent, ultimately leading to a swift victory before they have a chance to stabilize. The blend of creatures and spells in the deck allows for versatility in your approach, giving you options to adapt to different matchups and situations.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Lambholt Pacifist and Thalia's Lieutenant. Cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command provide additional value and versatility, allowing for unexpected game swings. Thalia, Heretic Cathar disrupts opponent's mana base and tempo, while Reflector Mage provides temporary removal. The deck also includes efficient card draw and ramp with cards like Thraben Inspector and Tireless Tracker. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with low-cost white creatures and pump them up with anthem effects like Always Watching and Thalia's Lieutenant. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of attackers while maintaining card advantage with cards like Thraben Inspector and Declaration in Stone. The inclusion of cards like Gryff's Boon and Anointer of Champions helps to protect our creatures and push through damage. With a low mana curve and aggressive playstyle, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By using cards like Mausoleum Wanderer, Spell Queller, and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, this deck aims to close out games quickly. The inclusion of counter spells like Clash of Wills and control spells like Stasis Snare provide additional versatility and protection for the deck's strategy. Overall, this deck is designed to be proactive and take control of the game early on.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence by playing creatures with efficient abilities and proactive threats. The deck focuses on using cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage to control the board and maintain pressure, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Archangel Avacyn and Elder Deep-Fiend to close out the game. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all three colors of mana needed for the deck's spells and abilities to function smoothly.

The deck focuses on deploying a wide range of aggressive creatures, backed up by disruptive creatures like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient creatures and tempo plays, while also utilizing cards like Collected Company to generate card advantage and put more threats on the battlefield. The deck also has some interaction with cards like Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient and versatile creatures like Reflector Mage, Spell Queller, Sylvan Advocate, and Tireless Tracker. These creatures can apply pressure on the opponent while providing utility and flexibility in different situations. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Field Researcher and Nissa, Vastwood Seer to generate card advantage and help maintain board control. Collected Company is used to further leverage the strength of the creature base and overwhelm the opponent with a sudden influx of threats. The mana base is designed to consistently support the diverse color requirements of the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient creatures and disrupting opponents with bounce effects while building a strong board presence. It utilizes cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Collected Company to flood the board with powerful creatures, while also using cards like Reflector Mage and Dromoka's Command to control the opponent's board. The mana base of the deck allows for consistent color fixing to ensure that spells can be cast on curve. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing creature buffs and removal spells, the deck aims to maintain control of the battlefield and keep the pressure on the opponent. With a strong curve of creatures and support spells, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a quick victory through efficient and aggressive combat strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of creatures that can be easily brought back from the graveyard, such as Haunted Dead and Prized Amalgam, along with disruptive spells like Collective Brutality and Grasp of Darkness to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Liliana, the Last Hope and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy provides additional card advantage and recursion, while Voldaren Pariah serves as a powerful finisher. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on using high-value creatures like Prized Amalgam and Voldaren Pariah to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive plays. It also includes powerful removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Ruinous Path to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's key strategy is to utilize graveyard interaction and synergies with cards like Haunted Dead and Relentless Dead, while also generating card advantage with Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Cryptbreaker. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient removal and graveyard recursion, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent and control the board with cards like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar. It aims to steadily grow its board presence with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Collected Company, using Dromoka's Command as removal and to protect its creatures. The deck also includes a few planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Tamiyo, Field Researcher to provide additional value and threats. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

This Bant Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage, the deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Archangel Avacyn ensures that the deck can maintain a strong board presence, while cards like Selfless Spirit provide protection against removal spells. Additionally, the deck includes some card advantage and card selection with Duskwatch Recruiter and Tamiyo, Field Researcher.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Reflector Mage, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Spell Queller and Selfless Spirit. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early on and maintain control of the board with cards like Dromoka's Command and Archangel Avacyn. Collected Company allows for additional creatures to be put onto the battlefield, and cards like Tireless Tracker and Nissa, Vastwood Seer provide card advantage and additional value.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with efficient creature plays such as Lambholt Pacifist and Thalia's Lieutenant, backed up by disruption and tempo plays like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar. The deck also utilizes cards like Tireless Tracker and Collected Company to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. Dromoka's Command serves as versatile removal and pump spell, while Tamiyo, Field Researcher provides card draw and additional utility. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while enabling consistent plays.
